body:
### Problem

Can consistently cause NeoVim to crash when just typing in insert mode, seemingly due to large completions list.
When LSP is disabled the crash does not occur, which is why I think it has something to do with the new NeoVim LSP capabilities.
I am not using omnifunc or anything at time of crash, nothing that I am doing is me interacting with the LS, it is something in the background.

```terraform

  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[  #<-- Typed up to here with no issues
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[" #<-- Crashed!
``` 

I don't believe it to be a Terraform specific issue for a few reasons:
- The exact same LS and test case works in VsCode without issue.
- The nvim process is the one using 100% CPU, I suspect it is a generic issue that just surfaces easily when using Terraform.
- It does not crash on every `[ ` in Terraform, it seems to only happen when I would expect the LS to be returning lots of information (All of the parameters of a resource for instance, which gets noisy quick).
  - Where it does crash it does so 100% consistently, just like it seems to work 100% consistent without issues in other places.

Apologies for not being able to offer more information up front, I am not a developer myself and my rudimentary stack traces revealed nothing, but I don't know if that is just me not knowing how to do that correctly.




### Steps to reproduce using "nvim -u minimal_init.lua"

1. Install Terraform LS

```bash
brew install terraform-ls`
```

2. Create `init.lua`

```lua
vim.lsp.config['tf'] = {
  -- Command and arguments to start the server.
  cmd = { "terraform-ls", "serve" },
  -- Filetypes to automatically attach to.
  filetypes = { 'terraform', 'terraform-vars' },
  -- Sets the "workspace" to the directory where any of these files is found.
  -- Files that share a root directory will reuse the LSP server connection.
  -- Nested lists indicate equal priority, see |vim.lsp.Config|.
  root_markers = { '.git' },
  -- Specific settings to send to the server. The schema is server-defined.
  -- Example: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LuaLS/vscode-lua/master/setting/schema.json
  settings = {
  }
}
vim.lsp.enable('tf')
vim.lsp.set_log_level("debug")
```

3. Create `main.tf`

```hcl
terraform {}

module "management" {
  source  = "Azure/avm-ptn-alz-management/azurerm"
  version = "0.6.0" # change this to your desired version, https://www.terraform.io/language/expressions/version-constraints
}

output "broken" {
  description = "Adding a double quote or a number after the [ on line 34 causes cpu to go to 100% and indefinitely hangs nvim"
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[
}
```

4. Attempt to edit line 10 in `main.tf`

a.
```bash
nvim -u init.lua main.tf
```

b. Move to line 10, and try to add a " or number

``` hcl
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[ 
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[" <-- Crash!
```



### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1471+gbe73c35943-Homebrew Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1760617492

### Language server name/version

terraformls 0.38.2

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS (WSL)
